articles.author: By DANIEL FLORES Staff Writer
articles.title: Torrential downpour floods Mid-Valley
articles.description: WESLACO — Yesterday morning’s thunderstorms unexpectedly unloaded a torrential downpour that left parts of the Rio Grande Valley, especially here and in the Mercedes area, decimated by flooding rivaling that of Hurricane Beulah in some spots.

articles.author: Verónica G. Cárdenas
articles.title: The Texans Who Are Mad as Hell About Trump's Border Wall
articles.description: Many feel the Trump administration’s proposed border wall is toxic and divisive. But in the Rio Grande Valley, it’s also bringing the community together. Here in South Texas, people who would normally be ideologically opposed are joining forces to fight again…

articles.title: Hundreds Arrested at Senate Office Building Protest

articles.title: A ‘music mecca?’: San Benito booking Mark Chesnutt, Lluvia Vega for May events
articles.description: SAN BENITO — Forget about calling it the Resaca City — it might soon be better known as music city.

articles.author: Colleen Long, Associated Press
articles.title: Trump officials pledge to reunite families amid border chaos
articles.description: A fact sheet on "zero-tolerance prosecution and family reunification" released Saturday night by the Department of Homeland Security and other agencies also says a parent must request that their child be deported with them.

articles.description: EDINBURG — A farmer-turned-developer here wants to gift Hidalgo County 20 acres of what he calls prime real estate off of Highway 281 to build the new county courthouse, but his offer comes as the project continues to pick up…

articles.title: Champion young farmer got early start
articles.description: Winning the National Young Champion Farmer title at Denbigh this year was simply the icing on the cake for Richard Johnson.After all, Johnson developed a passion for farming during the years he accompanied his father to his banana fields in Portland.
